business.headline: Lenskart share price jumps 5% after Q2 results. Here's all you need to knowLenskart's share price climbed to nearly 5% on the Bombay Stock Exchange around 9:37 am, reflecting renewed investor confidence following one of its best quarterly performances since listing.

Sensex, Nifty scale fresh peaks as Q2 GDP surprise lifts market moodBoth the S&P BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 touched fresh all-time highs in early trade. By 9:24 am, the Sensex was up 309.06 points at 86,015.73, while the Nifty50 rose 84.50 points to 26,287.45.

From OTPs, KYC to e-Sign: How everyday slips are fuelling a new wave of digital fraudFraudsters no longer hack systems, they hack human behaviour, using lookalike pages, cloned voices and urgent prompts. Even routine steps like OTPs, KYC and e-Sign are becoming easy entry points. Are consumers prepared for this new kind of digital deception?
HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

Are millennials relying too heavily on SIPs for wealth building?Millennials swear by SIPs for long term investing, but are they mistaking convenience for safety? As market cycles turn unpredictable, is it time to rethink what "safe investing" really means?

From tax deadlines to LPG, pensions: 5 major financial changes starting December 1Before December begins, it's worth noting that several new financial rules will kick in, affecting your bills, savings and even travel plans. Whether it's cooking gas, pension rules or tax filings, here's what to expect as the calendar turns.

Sudeep Pharma shares rise nearly 29% over IPO price. What should investors do?Sudeep Pharma's strong debut has impressed investors, but with valuations now stretched, is this the right moment to book profits or should investors stay put and ride the long-term story?

From GMP to price band: 5 things to know about Meesho IPOThe SoftBank-backed e-commerce platform has set a price band of Rs 105 to Rs 111 per share, valuing the company at nearly Rs 50,100 crore at the upper end.

Will your pension stop after November 30? Check nowThe deadline to submit the annual Life Certificate is almost here, and missing it could put your pension on hold. Pensioners must complete the process by 30 November to avoid any interruption.

New labour codes bring major employee benefits, but what are the big challenges?The new labour codes promise stronger protection and wider benefits for workers, but the real test begins now as businesses brace for higher costs, major restructuring and a challenging transition across sectors.

Why is tax department sending SMS alerts to 25,000 taxpayers about foreign assets?Tax officials examined data received from foreign jurisdictions through the Automatic Exchange of Information (AEOI) system. This international framework allows countries to share details of financial accounts held abroad by their residents.

Meesho IPO opening on December 3: What investors need to knowMeesho IPO is all set to open for subscription, backed by strong GMP cues and rising investor interest, but can the value-commerce giant turn pre-listing hype into sustained market performance? Here is all you need to know.

Is your money lying unclaimed? Here's how Delhi's new campaign help you recover itThe move is part of the Centre's ongoing 'Apki Punji, Apka Adhikar' campaign, which focuses on returning such funds to their rightful owners.

Sudeep Pharma makes strong market debut. Hold or book profit now?A blockbuster debut has rewarded Sudeep Pharma IPO investors. Should you cash out while sentiment is high or hold on for the company's expansion and export growth story?

Sudeep Pharma shares list at 23% premium in strong market debutThe Rs 895-crore issue, which was subscribed an extraordinary 93.71 times between November 21 and 25, opened at Rs 730 on the NSE and Rs 725 on the BSE, against the upper-end IPO price of Rs 593.

entertainment.headline: Soo Edible! Deepika's quip on Ranveer's IFFI look has fans calling her naughty Ranveer Singh's formal look for the IFFI closing ceremony prompted a flirty and enthusiastic response from his wife Deepika Padukone on Instagram, sparking a wave of reactions from their fans.

Tere Ishk Mein box office Day 3: Dhanush, Kriti film hits Rs 50 crore on 1st weekend Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's latest film Tere Ishk Mein, directed by Aanand L Rai, exceeded expectations by collecting over Rs 50 crore during its opening weekend, securing strong audience turnout and outpacing other releases.

Nandamuri Balakrishna's fan buys Akhanda 2 ticket for Rs 1 lakh in Germany. Watch A fan of Nandamuri Balakrishna bought the first ticket to Akhanda 2 for Rs 1 lakh at an auction organised by German distributors ahead of the film's international release.

Watch: The Summer I Turned Pretty stars Sean Kaufman, Christopher kiss at match Actor Sean Kaufman and Christopher Briney, known for their roles in The Summer I Turned Pretty, surprised fans with an unexpected on-camera kiss during the New York Knicks' home game against the Milwaukee Bucks at Madison Square Garden.

Nandamuri Balakrishna at 65: Last man standing of the genre he shaped While most senior stars have moved to sleeker, subtler and more modern formats of storytelling, Nandamuri Balakrishna continues to headline films filled with physics-defying action and unapologetic mass extravagance.

Rajkummar Rao celebrates daughter's birth by distributing sweets to paps. Watch Actor Rajkummar Rao celebrated the recent birth of his daughter by distributing sweets to photographers at a Mumbai event, drawing attention from fans and onlookers for his approachable gesture.

You're winner to me: Shehnaaz Gill's message after brother Shehbaz's BB 19 exit Shehbaz Badesha was eliminated from Bigg Boss 19 during a surprise double eviction, leaving six contestants in the race for the finale. His exit has sparked reactions from fellow housemates and his sister, Shehnaaz Gill.

Jaya Bachchan says Amitabh keeps opinions private: He knows when and how to convey Jaya Bachchan discussed the distinct differences between her and Amitabh Bachchan, offering insight into their relationship and the reasons behind her decision to marry him.

The Family Man 3 has a scene-stealer twist: Children outshine the star cast Amid the chaos of covert ops, it's the family's fractures and healing that strike the deepest in The Family Man 3. While Manoj Bajpayee and Jaideep Ahlawat command the spotlight, it's the children, Atharv and Dhriti, who win the emotional battle.

Jenna Ortega voices AI concern at film festival: We've opened Pandora's box Actor Jenna Ortega expressed her apprehension regarding artificial intelligence during an appearance at the Marrakech Film Festival, citing the unsettling uncertainty AI introduces to filmmaking and society.

Britney Spears reflects on resilience and personal growth after Instagram return Singer Britney Spears shared an introspective message with fans, following her return to Instagram earlier in the month. The post comes after Spears deactivated her account amid a public dispute with ex-husband Kevin Federline, and highlights her thoughts on overcoming hardships in life.

Vanessa Hudgens, Cole Tucker welcome second child: What a wild ride labor is Vanessa Hudgens and husband Cole Tucker recently welcomed their second child with a special post on social media. The announcement expands their family to four, with Hudgens sharing the news from her hospital bed.

BTS' V sparks buzz with 2025 Ford Mustang GTD photos, fans speculate price BTS V, also known as Taehyung, showcased a luxury car, a 2025 Ford Mustang GTD, to his followers on Instagram on November 28. The new car, spotted among photos of V spending time with friends, has drawn attention from fans and car enthusiasts alike.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Shehbaz Badesha evicted due to lack of votes Shehbaz Badesha has been evicted from 'Bigg Boss 19' due to a lack of votes. The grand finale of the reality show hosted by Salman Khan is scheduled for December 7.

Bigg Boss 19: Ashnoor Kaur reacts to sudden exit, says the show goes on Actor Ashnoor Kaur interacted with her followers on Instagram LIVE following her unexpected exit from 'Bigg Boss 19'. She reacted to her sudden exit, claims of an unfair exit and expressing gratitude to fans.

Bollywood producer's plea against cheque bouncing sentence dismissed The Mumbai Sessions Court has upheld the conviction of Bollywood producer Abdul Samee Siddiqui in a cheque bounce case. He has produced movies like 'Horn OK Please' and 'Halla Bol'.

Bharti Singh shares maternity photoshoot pics. Parineeti, Varun Dhawan react Comedian Bharti Singh surprised her fans and social media followers by sharing pictures from her maternity photoshoot. Actors Parineeti Chopra and Varun Dhawan, among others, have liked and commented on the post.

Sidhu Moose Wala's Barota hits 28M views, races to No 1 on YouTube in 48 hours Punjabi singer Sidhu Moose Wala's latest posthumous track 'Barota' has garnered over 28 million views on YouTube within 48 hours of release. The song has secured the number one spot on YouTube's music charts.

Abhishek's emotional post for Ashnoor after her eviction: You became my calm Abhishek Bajaj visited Ashnoor Kaur's home after her eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19'. He shared images, a video and a heartfelt note about her performance and their friendship during the show.

general news.headline: Ready to give tips on how to perform: PM mocks Opposition ahead of Winter SessionPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday appealed to Opposition leaders to not turn the Winter Session of Parliament into a battleground for creating drama and mocked them, saying he could give tips on how to perform their official duties.

Parliament Winter Session begins today; SIR, BLO suicides in Opposition's arsenal  Live UpdatesParliament's Winter Session is likely to witness a stormy start on Monday with the Opposition sharpening its arsenal to press for a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) as the government expressed its willingness to discuss any issue as per rules.

Notorious traffic, useless cops: UP MP's all-out attack over Bengaluru chaosSamajwadi Party MP Rajeev Rai was stuck in Bengaluru traffic for over an hour, just ahead of his flight to Delhi to attend the Parliament's Winter Session.

Siddaramaiah-Shivakumar breakfast meet round 2 likely tomorrow amid power tussleKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar are likely to meet for a second breakfast meeting at the latter's residence in Bengaluru amid rising speculation over a power-sharing arrangement.

After Rohit Sharma, is Virat transforming his style to push for 2027 World Cup?IND vs SA: Virat Kohli scored a commanding hundred in the first of three ODIs against South Africa. The template of this century was quite different from the ones we have seen Kohli hit in his career.

How trade war with poor Afghanistan is bleeding PakistanPakistan's decision to halt trade with Afghanistan, which defence minister Khwaja Asif said was "a blessing in disguise", is backfiring. This is why the ban is hitting Pakistan's own economy hard while the Taliban regime in Afghanistan is finding alternative routes and partners like India.

Live: Parliament to begin shortly, Priyanka Gandhi reacts to PM's appeal to OppositionParliament Session Live: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, speaking at the start of the Winter Session of Parliament, said the session will contribute to the ongoing efforts to take the nation towards greater progress. He said the world is witnessing both the strength of India's democracy and the resilience of its economy, adding that India has proved that "democracy can deliver." PM Modi urged the Opposition to fulfil its responsibility, stressing that the session is not a ritual but an opportunity to accelerate national development. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates on the Winter Session of the Parliament.

Can anti-India lawmaker Ilhan Omar be deported from US amid fraud claims?Allegations of marriage and immigration fraud against Ilhan Omar, known for her anti-India stand, have resurfaced again, and a section of American citizens are demanding her denaturalisation and deportation from the US. But is it possible to do so for a naturalised US citizen, who is also an elected Democratic representative?

The Family Man 3 has a scene-stealer twist: Children outshine the star castAmid the chaos of covert ops, it's the family's fractures and healing that strike the deepest in The Family Man 3. While Manoj Bajpayee and Jaideep Ahlawat command the spotlight, it's the children, Atharv and Dhriti, who win the emotional battle.
Amazon's Siddharth Bhagat Breaks Down India's New Beauty Economy—From Global Trends to Tech-Led DiscoveryTracing India's changing beauty codes.

GRAP-IV curbs to kick in across Mumbai areas breaching AQI 200 mark for 3 daysThe Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has announced that GRAP-IV restrictions, including closure of construction sites, will be implemented if air quality remains above 200 for three consecutive days in certain pockets of the city.

ED issues notice to Kerala Chief Minister in Rs 2000-crore masala bond caseThe Enforcement Directorate has issued a Rs 466-crore FEMA show cause notice to Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, former finance minister Thomas Issac, and KM Abraham over alleged violations in KIIFB's 2019 masala bond issue.

Indian man's big Bollywood dance proposal at Times Square leaves girlfriend emotionalParth Maniar planned a grand dance-filled surprise in front of hundreds of people as he asked Shreya Singh to marry him.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Rajasthan's U-turn on plan to mark Babri Masjid demolition day as Shaurya DiwasA political controversy has erupted in Rajasthan after the Education Department withdrew its order to celebrate December 6 as Shaurya Diwas in government schools. The move followed strong backlash from opposition parties and civil rights groups accusing the government of communalising education.

Elon Musk reveals son's name is Sekhar, discloses partner's Indian heritageElon Musk revealed his partner Shivon Zilis has Indian ancestry and one of their sons is named after Nobel laureate Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar. He also spoke about the role of Indian professionals in the United States.

Nandamuri Balakrishna at 65: Last man standing of the genre he shapedWhile most senior stars have moved to sleeker, subtler and more modern formats of storytelling, Nandamuri Balakrishna continues to headline films filled with physics-defying action and unapologetic mass extravagance.

Soo Edible! Deepika's quip on Ranveer's IFFI look has fans calling her naughtyRanveer Singh's formal look for the IFFI closing ceremony prompted a flirty and enthusiastic response from his wife Deepika Padukone on Instagram, sparking a wave of reactions from their fans.

Delhi's air quality worsens as AQI nears very poor category after brief respiteDelhi's air quality worsened again on Monday, with the AQI at 298, just a few notches from the 'very poor' range. This follows a short-lived improvement in air quality to the 'poor' category due to strong winds.

Video: School attendant beats up nursery student, pushes and kicks her on groundA school attendant in Hyderabad has been detained after a video surfaced showing her beating a nursery student at a private school. The incident, which was filmed by a neighbour, has prompted a police investigation and the child was hospitalised with injuries.

Who was the Nobel-winning astrophysicist Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar?Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar's discovery of the Chandrasekhar Limit revolutionised astrophysics. His work continues to inspire students and shape scientific understanding of stars.

Virat Kohli or Sachin Tendulkar: Gavaskar picks his greatest ODI batterSunil Gavaskar hailed Virat Kohli as the greatest ODI batter after his 52nd hundred in Ranchi, saying even Ricky Ponting calls him the best he has seen and that surpassing Sachin Tendulkar leaves Kohli at the very top.

Virat Kohli fan evades security, falls at his feet interrupting hundred celebrationVirat Kohli scored his 52nd ODI century during the first match against South Africa in Ranchi. A pitch invader interrupted his century celebration by falling at his feet.

Centre's big crackdown on pan masala, gutkha; Nirmala Sitharaman to introduce billThe government is set to introduce a stringent new law targeting the gutkha and pan masala industry, aiming to enhance health and national security through a special cess. This move promises to overhaul the sector with strict compliance and oversight measures.

George Clooney says he hated Brad Pitt after losing Thelma & Louise roleGeorge Clooney has revealed he narrowly missed out on Brad Pitt's breakout role in Thelma & Louise. In the latest interview, he admitted the loss frustrated him for years before the two eventually became close friends.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar begins limited advance booking in select cinemasWith less than a week until its release, Dhurandhar is creating excitement among cinema audiences as advance bookings have started in limited locations. However, worldwide sales are yet to begin.

sports.headline: 10-man Chelsea frustrate Arsenal, Liverpool end rot vs West Ham Chelsea held Arsenal to a 1-1 draw despite being reduced to ten men. Liverpool defeated West Ham 2-0, with Alexander Isak scoring his first Premier League goal for the club as the Reds ended a difficult stretch of form.

Grew up watching Kohli on TV, bowling to him is fun yet annoying: Marco Jansen South Africa's Marco Jansen reflected on the difficulty and enjoyment of bowling to Virat Kohli after India's 17-run win in the opening ODI. Kohli's 52nd ODI hundred helped India take a 1-0 lead in the series, while Jansen shared candid insights into the challenge of facing the Indian star.

If not for Rana's early wickets, SA would've easily chased 350: Sitanshu Kotak Harshit Rana's early wickets helped India defend 349 against South Africa in Ranchi. He finished the match with figures of 3/65 in ten overs helping India register a 17-run victory.

Indian team least bothered, concerned about SA coach's grovel remark: Kotak India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak says the team is unfazed by South Africa coach, Shukhri Conrad's "grovel" remark after the Ranchi ODI, stressing focus remains on performance.

Don't ask any questions, Virat and Rohit have sealed World Cup spots: Srikkanth Former India selector Kris Srikkanth feels that Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have already sealed their spots for World Cup 2027 and no questions should be asked on their places in the squad for the tournament.

Harsha Bhogle reveals chat with Kohli before question on Test comeback rumours Indian commentator Harsha Bhogle revealed his conversation with Virat Kohli before asking him about his Test comeback rumours. Despite speculation, Kohli confirmed he will continue playing only ODIs, ruling out a Test comeback.

Max Verstappen wins Qatar GP to ensure three-way title showdown in Abu Dhabi Max Verstappen secured his third consecutive win at the Qatar Grand Prix, to push the championship battle into a three-way tussle inAbu Dhabi. Norris's lead was reduced to 12 points following a fourth-place finish, with McLaren's strategy calls under scrutiny.

Inside Kohli's ODI preparations: How India's 37-year-old master keeps dominating IND vs SA, 1st ODI:  Despite the wealth of experience he carries and his status as an ODI great, Virat Kohli still believes the core of batting lies in the mind. He relies on visualising situations and feeling sharp and switched on, placing greater value on mental clarity than on long, repetitive preparation.

After Rohit Sharma, is Virat transforming his style to push for 2027 World Cup? IND vs SA: Virat Kohli scored a commanding hundred in the first of three ODIs against South Africa. The template of this century was quite different from the ones we have seen Kohli hit in his career.

Virat and Rohit have made oppositions look silly, fun to see them: KL Rahul India skipper KL Rahul marvelled at how Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma can make opposition attacks look "silly", praising the stalwarts after their defining knocks in the first ODI against South Africa on Sunday.

Rohit, Kohli for 2027 World Cup: India coach says focus on enjoying their form now India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak dismissed speculation over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's 2027 World Cup futures, insisting the team is focused on enjoying their current form after India's 17-run win in Ranchi.

Norris's lead was reduced to 12 points following a fourth-place finish, with McLaren's strategy calls under scrutiny.

He relies on visualising situations and feeling sharp and switched on, placing greater value on mental clarity than on long, repetitive preparation.

Virat and Rohit have made oppositions look silly, fun to see them: KL Rahul India skipper KL Rahul marvelled at how Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma can make opposition attacks look "silly", praising the stalwarts after their defining knocks in the first ODI against South Africa on Sunday.

Rohit, Kohli for 2027 World Cup: India coach says focus on enjoying their form now India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak dismissed speculation over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's 2027 World Cup futures, insisting the team is focused on enjoying their current form after India's 17-run win in Ranchi.

IND vs SA: Aiden Markram proud of Jansen, Bosch's valiant fight in Ranchi thrillerSouth Africa captain Aiden Markram expressed pride in his team's fightback despite a top-order collapse that left them chasing the match in their 17-run defeat to India in the first ODI in Ranchi. After crashing to 11 for 3, spirited innings from Marco Jansen, Matthew Breetzke and Corbin Bosch took the contest into the final over, reinforcing the Proteas' belief ahead of the next match.

India shock Iran 2-1 to seal 2026 AFC U17 Asian Cup qualificationIndia's U17 side produced a brilliant comeback to defeat favourites Iran 2–1 in a must-win qualifier in Ahmedabad. The result sealed their spot in the 2026 AFC U17 Asian Cup, marking a major milestone for the squad.

India Beats South Africa by 17 Runs in First ODI as Virat Kohli Hits 52nd CenturyOn this Special Report, the focus is on India's victory over South Africa in the first ODI of the three-match series in Ranchi. The speaker highlights Virat Kohli's return to form with his 52nd ODI century, noting it as a crucial performance for the team's confidence ahead of the 2027 World Cup. The report also mentions Kuldeep Yadav's four-wicket haul and Rohit Sharma's half-century as key factors in the 17-run win. The analysis underscores the importance of this victory following a recent Test series defeat.

India vs South Africa: Harshit Rana finds his length in ODIsFast bowler Harshit Rana delivered a fiery opening spell against South Africa in Ranchi, finally offering a glimpse of why the Indian team management has persisted with him in the ODI setup. Playing just his 10th match, Rana bowled with purpose and clarity, justifying the faith invested in his raw pace and temperament.

Virat Kohli reacts to Test comeback rumours, says will continue to play only ODIsIND vs SA: India stalwart Virat Kohli shut down the growing buzz around a possible Test return himself during the post-match presentation of India's Ranchi ODI against South Africa.

Virat Kohli special in Ranchi thriller drags India out of week-long Test gloomIndia vs South Africa: Senior batter Virat Kohli lit up a Super Sunday in Ranchi with a sublime 135, his 52nd ODI hundred, as India survived a tense finish to defend 18 runs in the final over and clinch a 17-run win in a last-over thriller.

Steve Smith tests anti-glare eye patches ahead of pink-ball Gabba TestAustralia's Steve Smith was seen using anti-glare eye black during a floodlit training session ahead of the crucial day-night Ashes Test at the Gabba, mirroring Shivnarine Chanderpaul's iconic look. Smith is searching for answers to visibility issues that have affected his pink-ball batting record, with hopes the new approach may offer an edge against England.

Zirkzee, Mount inspire Manchester United's comeback win at Crystal PalaceManchester United came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1 at Selhurst Park, ending a five-year win drought. The victory boosts United's Premier League standing while raising concerns over Palace's congested schedule.

Virat Kohli reacts to Test comeback rumours, says will continue to play only ODIsIND vs SA: India stalwart Virat Kohli shut down the growing buzz around a possible Test return himself during the post-match presentation of India's Ranchi ODI against South Africa.

Virat Kohli special in Ranchi thriller drags India out of week-long Test gloomIndia vs South Africa: Senior batter Virat Kohli lit up a Super Sunday in Ranchi with a sublime 135, his 52nd ODI hundred, as India survived a tense finish to defend 18 runs in the final over and clinch a 17-run win in a last-over thriller.

Steve Smith tests anti-glare eye patches ahead of pink-ball Gabba TestAustralia's Steve Smith was seen using anti-glare eye black during a floodlit training session ahead of the crucial day-night Ashes Test at the Gabba, mirroring Shivnarine Chanderpaul's iconic look. Smith is searching for answers to visibility issues that have affected his pink-ball batting record, with hopes the new approach may offer an edge against England.

Zirkzee, Mount inspire Manchester United's comeback win at Crystal PalaceManchester United came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1 at Selhurst Park, ending a five-year win drought. The victory boosts United's Premier League standing while raising concerns over Palace's congested schedule.

Shikha Pandey Sold To UP Warriorz For Rs 2.4 Crore In WPL 2026 AuctionIn this exclusive interview, veteran Indian pacer Shikha Pandey opens up about her move to UP Warriorz after being bought for Rs 2.4 crore in the WPL 2026 auction. Speaking to India Today, Pandey admits she was 'anxious' before the bidding but felt 'valued' by the price tag, which was the third-highest in the auction. She reflects on her time with Delhi Capitals, her close bond with former teammate Jemimah Rodrigues, and the origin of her nickname 'Shikipedia'. Pandey also discusses the growing importance of global franchise leagues like the WBBL and The Hundred for players who are not currently in the national team setup.

Special Report: Analysis of Recent ODI Match and Batting MilestonesThis special report covers a recent One Day International cricket match in Ranchi, highlighting a record-breaking partnership between two senior batters. The discussion analyses their centuries and half-centuries, which set a formidable target for the opposition. The speaker explores the players' fitness transformations and their strategic importance for the upcoming 2027 World Cup. The report also addresses speculation regarding their future in the team and the necessity of consistent performances in the ODI format.

Treesa-Gayatri defend women's doubles crown, Srikanth suffers heartbreakIndia wrapped up the Syed Modi International Super 300 with mixed fortunes on Sunday, as Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand stylishly defended their women's doubles crown, while Kidambi Srikanth's long title drought extended after a heartbreaking three-game defeat in the men's singles final.

Virat Kohli or Sachin Tendulkar: Gavaskar picks his greatest ODI batterSunil Gavaskar hailed Virat Kohli as the greatest ODI batter after his 52nd hundred in Ranchi, saying even Ricky Ponting calls him the best he has seen and that surpassing Sachin Tendulkar leaves Kohli at the very top.

Rohit Sharma's expletive-laden celebration of Virat Kohli's century goes viralIndia vs South Africa: Former India captain Rohit Sharma's raw and unfiltered reaction to Virat Kohli's record-extending 52nd century during the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi went viral.

Special Report: Indian Batters Smash Records in ODI Match Against South AfricaThis special report provides coverage of an ODI cricket match between India and South Africa. The broadcast highlights a significant century scored by a top-order Indian batter, marking a major milestone in his career. It also details a record-breaking performance by the team captain, who surpassed a long-standing record for the most sixes in the format. The segment describes a 136-run partnership between the two senior players and notes the dismissal of one batter by a South African pacer. The report concludes with an update on the match situation as the centurion continues his innings.

Rohit Sharma Breaks Shahid Afridi's All-Time Record for Most ODI Sixes in RanchiOn this Special Report, the focus is on the 1st ODI between India and South Africa in Ranchi. Rohit Sharma has created history by breaking Shahid Afridi's long-standing record for the most sixes in ODI cricket. The 'Hitman' achieved this feat while batting alongside Virat Kohli, with the duo—dubbed 'Roko'—looking to dominate. Stand-in captain KL Rahul leads the side in the absence of injured regulars. South Africa won the toss and opted to bowl first in this crucial series opener.

Virat Kohli fan evades security, falls at his feet interrupting hundred celebrationVirat Kohli scored his 52nd ODI century during the first match against South Africa in Ranchi. A pitch invader interrupted his century celebration by falling at his feet.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
